div.p: Understorey palm. Stem solitary, erect, 2-8 m tall and 6-10 cm in diameter, wood rather soft. Leaves 10-20 in the crown; sheath and petiole 50-150 cm long; blade 120-220 cm long, divided into 7-20 unequal pinnae on each side, the central ones 55-85 cm long and 5-20 cm wide. Inflorescence once branched, more or less hidden in the leaf axil, and enclosed in a net-like peduncular bract until fruit maturity; peduncle 10-25 cm long; rachis 4-10 cm long; branches 9-16, 15-40 cm long and 5-13 mm in diameter, with flower pits usually in 10 longitudinal rows, the surface often more or less dissolved into fibres. Fruits yellow to orange, elongate, 8-10 mm long.
Andean foothills in Colombia and Ecuador, W of the Andes, usually at 500-1000 m elevation.
